activities.loc: Br 9 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy L Abbott

records.addlTxt:
8:36 AM Defendant Timothy L Abbott in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Timothy L Abbott.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense filed a bond motion and moves to modify bond to a high signature bond.
State objects.
BTC: Motion to modify bond denied.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re: bond reduction
Letter from defendant re: Bond reduction
Defense.
Letter from defendant re: bond reduction

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***ALSO $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.**
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.
NG plea entered.

10:18 AM Defendant Timothy L Abbott in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Angrove on behalf of Ashley Castro in court for Timothy L Abbott.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Alycia Bein. 
Preliminary hearing waived, probable cause found, bound over. 
Defense asks to modify bond to a signature bond
State objects
BTC: Modify bond to $2,500 cash bond and a $500 Signature bond and SCRAM.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:35 PM Defendant Timothy L Abbott appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for Timothy L Abbott.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. Defense challenges probable cause in Ct 1. State responds and asks for motion to be denied. 
BTC: Motion denied.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
